TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit IsolatedStorage extends System.MarshalByRefObject
Public MustInherit Class IsolatedStorage Inherits MarshalByRefObject
public ref class IsolatedStorage abstract : MarshalByRefObject

Docs.summary: Represents the abstract base class from which all isolated storage implementations must derive.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
[!INCLUDE [untrusted-data-class-note](~/includes/untrusted-data-class-note.md)]
For information about file-based isolated storage, see the <xref:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorageFile> class.
> [!IMPORTANT] > Isolated storage is not available for [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] apps. Instead, use the application data classes in the `Windows.Storage` namespaces included in the [!INCLUDE[wrt](~/includes/wrt-md.md)] API to store local data and files. For more information, see [Application data](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=229175) in the Windows Dev Center.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ApplicationIdentity As Object
public: property System::Object ^ ApplicationIdentity { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets an application identity that scopes isolated storage.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Since the definition of an application includes all assemblies associated with the application, you can use this type of identity to ensure that only assemblies associated with the application have access to the isolated storage.

Docs.exception: The code lacks the required to access this object. These permissions are granted by the runtime based on security policy.
The object is not isolated by the application .
Docs.permission: for the ability to access evidence. Associated enumeration:

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property AssemblyIdentity As Object
public: property System::Object ^ AssemblyIdentity { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets an assembly identity used to scope isolated storage.
Docs.exception: The code lacks the required to access this object.
Docs.permission: for the ability to access evidence. Associated enumeration:

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property AvailableFreeSpace As Long
public: virtual property long AvailableFreeSpace { long get(); };

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the available free space for isolated storage, in bytes.
Docs.value: The available free space for isolated storage, in bytes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorageFile.AvailableFreeSpace%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property overrides this property.

Docs.exception: An operation was performed that requires access to , but that property is not defined for this store. Stores that are obtained by using enumerations do not have a well-defined property, because partial evidence is used to open the store.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property CurrentSize As ULong
public: virtual property System::UInt64 CurrentSize { System::UInt64 get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("IsolatedStorage.CurrentSize has been deprecated because it is not CLS Compliant. To get the current size use IsolatedStorage.UsedSize")

Docs.summary: Gets a value representing the current size of isolated storage.
Docs.value: The number of storage units currently used within the isolated storage scope.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property represents the total usage of all storage resources within the isolated storage scope. <xref:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorageFile.CurrentSize%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> implements this property. In the case of <xref:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorageFile> objects, this value is in bytes. In the case of implementations of other storage objects, such as a database, this value might be in other units of storage.

Docs.exception: The current size of the isolated store is undefined.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Security.Permissions.IsolatedStoragePermission GetPermission(class System.Security.PermissionSet ps) cil managed
Protected MustOverride Function GetPermission (ps As PermissionSet) As IsolatedStoragePermission

Docs.param: The object that contains the set of permissions granted to code attempting to use isolated storage.
Docs.summary: When implemented by a derived class, returns a permission that represents access to isolated storage from within a permission set.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You call this method on derived classes to determine what permission type governs their use, and to return the permission of the type that has been granted. Use this information to determine the allowable quota and any other derived class-specific isolated storage settings.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool IncreaseQuotaTo(int64 newQuotaSize) cil managed
Public Overridable Function IncreaseQuotaTo (newQuotaSize As Long) As Boolean
abstract member IncreaseQuotaTo : int64 -> bool override this.IncreaseQuotaTo : int64 -> bool

Docs.param: The requested new quota size, in bytes, for the user to approve.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, prompts a user to approve a larger quota size, in bytes, for isolated storage.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorageFile.IncreaseQuotaTo%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method overrides this method.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new object using either domain or application evidence.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property MaximumSize As ULong
public: virtual property System::UInt64 MaximumSize { System::UInt64 get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("IsolatedStorage.MaximumSize has been deprecated because it is not CLS Compliant. To get the maximum size use IsolatedStorage.Quota")

Docs.summary: Gets a value representing the maximum amount of space available for isolated storage. When overridden in a derived class, this value can take different units of measure.
Docs.value: The maximum amount of isolated storage space in bytes. Derived classes can return different units of value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The default implementation of the <xref:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorage.MaximumSize%2A> property returns the value of <xref:System.Security.Permissions.IsolatedStoragePermission.UserQuota%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>, which is expressed in bytes. Derived classes can express the value in other units of measure. A potential example of such an implementation is an isolated storage database.
You cannot set <xref:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorage.MaximumSize%2A>, but the quota is configured in the security policy, and can be set. Code receives a quota of space on the basis of its evidence, so the same code can receive a different quota if it is run with different evidence (for example, the same application run locally and from a share on an intranet can receive different quotas). <xref:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorageFile.MaximumSize%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> implements this property.

Docs.exception: The quota has not been defined.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property Quota As Long
public: virtual property long Quota { long get(); };

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that represents the maximum amount of space available for isolated storage.
Docs.value: The limit of isolated storage space, in bytes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorageFile.Quota%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property overrides this property.

Docs.exception: An operation was performed that requires access to , but that property is not defined for this store. Stores that are obtained by using enumerations do not have a well-defined property, because partial evidence is used to open the store.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Remove() cil managed

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, removes the individual isolated store and all contained data.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Scope As IsolatedStorageScope

Docs.summary: Gets an enumeration value specifying the scope used to isolate the store.
Docs.value: A bitwise combination of values specifying the scope used to isolate the store.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Stores are isolated by a combination of factors (user, assembly, domain, and so on).

MemberSignature.Value: Protected Overridable ReadOnly Property SeparatorExternal As Char
protected: virtual property char SeparatorExternal { char get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a backslash character that can be used in a directory string. When overridden in a derived class, another character might be returned.
Docs.value: The default implementation returns the '\\' (backslash) character.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property can be used to get a character that is used in a directory string.

block.para: When you inherit from , you can override and return a character other than the '\\' to control the naming syntax of the store. In a Windows this separator is a '\\'.

MemberSignature.Value: Protected Overridable ReadOnly Property SeparatorInternal As Char
protected: virtual property char SeparatorInternal { char get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a period character that can be used in a directory string. When overridden in a derived class, another character might be returned.
Docs.value: The default implementation returns the '.' (period) character.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property can be used to get a character that is used in a directory string.

block.para: When you inherit from , you can override and return a character other than the '.' to control the naming syntax of the store. In a Windows this separator is a '.'.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property UsedSize As Long
public: virtual property long UsedSize { long get(); };

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that represents the amount of the space used for isolated storage.
Docs.value: The used amount of isolated storage space, in bytes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorageFile.UsedSize%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property overrides this property.

Docs.exception: An operation was performed that requires access to , but that property is not defined for this store. Stores that are obtained by using enumerations do not have a well-defined property, because partial evidence is used to open the store.
